issuetype.description: A problem which impairs or prevents the functions of the product.
issuetype.name: Bug

resolution.description: A fix for this issue is checked into the tree and tested.
resolution.name: Fixed

status.description: The issue is considered finished, the resolution is correct. Issues which are not closed can be reopened.
status.name: Closed

fields.summary: JDBC driver makes 2 Open Session Calls for every open session

comments.body: Fixes Hive-13264 by refactoring the code to retry in openSession layer instead of openTransport.
Refactored the code in HiveConnection to do the connection retry at openSession level instead of OpenConnection.
Rebased the patch on trunk.

Here are the results of testing the latest attachment:
https://issues.apache.org/jira/secure/attachment/12793899/HIVE-13264.1.patch

ATTACHMENT ID: 12798636 - PreCommit-HIVE-TRUNK-Build
Rebased on trunk due to merge conflict

[~nithinmahesh] I thought the issue is with the extra OpenSession RPC call within HiveConnection#createHttpTransport (https://github.com/apache/hive/blob/master/jdbc/src/java/org/apache/hive/jdbc/HiveConnection.java#L257). I don't see your patch addressing that.
